column5: do u catch them here in the winter?, because all i have seen so far is X amount of perch being caught  and if u do catch them, where do u go and what do u use
Go to the south end of the bay, bring some reasonable sized minnows or frozen sardines, set up some dead stick lines and have patience Grasshopper

what he said. The one time I fished Cooks Bay for pike was at opener in May. Had to be 50 boats all anchored down there at the bottom end of the Bay fishing live bait under bobbers for pike. We moved around a bit and caught some on artificials. While we were down near the "fleet" we did see that success was being had
Nothing better then sitting in a hut and watching a great big head move slowly into view of the hole.
